vague_description: A market owner is trying to find the optimal way to sell a limited amount of jam using different packaging options while meeting certain constraints on production costs and quantities.
detailed_description: A market owner wants to start a jam business. He can either sell one unit of jam to customers in a set of small packets or jugs. A set of small packets can hold \param{VolumeSmallPackets} ml of jam while a jug can hold \param{VolumeJug} ml of jam. Since a set of small packets are more expensive to make, at least \param{JugPacketRatio} times as many jugs must be used than sets of small packets. On the other hand, at least \param{MinSmallPackets} sets of small packets should be filled. If the market owner has \param{TotalJam} ml of jam, how many sets of small packets or jugs should be selected to maximize the total number of units that he can sell to his customers?
target_objective: Maximize the total number of units (sets of small packets and jugs) the market owner can sell
target_constraints: Number of sets of small packets is non-negative
Total volume of jam in sets of small packets and jugs cannot exceed TotalJam ml
At least JugPacketRatio times as many jugs as sets of small packets must be used
At least MinSmallPackets sets of small packets should be filled
target_parameters: Volume for a set of small packets
Ratio of the number of jugs to sets of small packets
Minimum number of sets of small packets
